intro: Cathartolinum striatum, commonly known as the striped cathartolinum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, narrow leaves with distinct longitudinal stripes. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
